mundo

Class Comparador

  • java.lang.Object
    • mundo.Comparador

  • public class Comparador
extends java.lang.Object
    This class takes the number generated by "elGenerador" sorts and compares it with the number given by the user, giving back to the interface the dots and comas array to be shown based on the wining way. the objective is to get the number which the program generated. once the player writes and compares the number, there will appear a dot for each number who is in the right place and a coma for each number in the wrong place, if the number is not in the objective number, there will not appear anything. The objective number can't have the same number twice
    Author:
    Cristian Guatuzmal

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Comparador()
      This is the constructor, there, the relation is initialized, numeroDeCifras receives the first value of 4 and the value of generarNumero() in elGenerador is given to numeroObjetivo

      • ordenamiento

        public java.lang.String ordenamiento(java.lang.String comasEnBruto)
        This method is called inside puntosYComas(), and it's purpose is to put the dots and comas in a standard distribution, so the dots and comas positions don't match with the position of the found number
        Parameters:
        comasEnBruto: - which is the String to be sorted
        Returns:
        a dots and comas String sorted, making all the dots and all the comas being appended in groups

      • getElGenerador

        public Generador getElGenerador()
        This is a getter intended to give access to the methods of the class to other methods
        Returns:
        elGenerador

      • puntosYComas

        public java.lang.String puntosYComas()
        This is the most important method, this method compares the number given by the user with the number generated by elGenerador, giving dots and comas according to the game rules
        Returns:
        Sorted String of dots and comas, ready to be showed to the player
